metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5863 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In an ioctl handler in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, FirefoxOS for MSM, or QRD Android, several sanity checks are missing which canlead to out-of-bounds accesses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55
linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-36.55
linux-image-4.4.0-36-lowlatency - 4.4.0-36.55
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-36.55
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-36.55
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-36.55
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-36.55
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1021-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1021.27
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1024-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1024.27
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-36.55').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1021.27').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1024.27').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-euclid package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9019.20').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
